result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew O Hoff Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed.

No alcohol.

No contact with Lucky's Tavern in Clear Lake. 

Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
Must maintain full time employment, school and/or seek work.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation. Not subject to good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew O Hoff Jr

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Matthew O Hoff Jr in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Matthew O Hoff Jr.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Defendant now appears late. CT quashes warrant previously authorized.  Felony warnings given. On count 1- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Count 2 and 3 RI&D on state's motion. Atty Satorious requests 2 days credit. Def addresses ct. 

SENTENCE:  W/held sent 3 years probation. Must report to probation today. 12 months stayed jail. Not subj to GT. 2 days credit. AODA and comply. AS. No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. No alcohol. Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. Any treatment/programming required by agent. Must maintain full time job or full time school/seek full time work. No contact with Lucky's Tavern in Clear Lake.  $550.05 fine/costs, includes $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. PCR. 11:54 am adj.
